full_summary:
# Request for Information (RFI) Notice: [SDA240025]
## Overview
The Copyright Board of Canada (Commission du droit d'auteur) has released a Request for Information (RFI) notice seeking supplier input to inform the compilation of a report on the copyright industry in Canada. The report aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the market, including its needs and current state.

## Notice Details
- **RFI Reference:** [cb-701-40147116]
- **Amendment:** 1
- **Publication Date:** May 15, 2024
- **RFI Closing Date:** June 5, 2024, 4:00 PM EST
- **Expected Contract Start and End Dates:** None

## Notice Type and Procurement Method
- **Notice Type:** Request for Information
- **Procurement Method:** Competitive, Open Bidding

## Contracting Entity
- **Contracting Entity:** Copyright Board of Canada
- **Address:** Suite 800, 56 Sparks Street, Ottawa, ON K1A 0C9, Canada

## Contact Information
- **Contact Name:** Jude Laurent
- **Email:** <>procurement@pbc-clcc.gc.ca
- **Phone:** (450) 374-4751

## Documents
- **RFI Notice (English):** <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/38172/sda240025--rfi---copyright-market-analysis-_-en.pdf>
- **RFI Notice (French):** <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/38172/sda240025--rfi---copyright-market-analysis_fr_0.pdf>

## Description of the Market Analysis Report
The report aims to provide a comprehensive overview of the copyright industry in Canada, its current state, and potential future directions. The information collected will help the Copyright Board of Canada prepare a report on the market profile and inform its decisions related to copyright licensing and pricing. Suppliers are invited to submit information on their company profiles, services offered, and relevant experience.

Please provide your rewritten text in markdown format, ideally structured with headings and clear paragraphs as I provided in my rewritten entry. Make sure to respect the original data shared with you but ensure a clear, concise, and professional tone is communicated throughout. The less red-actor words you keep, the better this output is for translation if needed.
